de.susebox.jtopas
Interface WhitespaceHandler

All Superinterfaces:
Plugin
All Known Implementing Classes:
TestPluginTokenizer

public interface WhitespaceHandler
extends Plugin

This interface must be implemented by classes that should be used as a whitespace handler pluggin in the PluginTokenizer.

This interface is deprecated. Use the new WhitespaceHandler interface instead.

Author:
Heiko Blau
See Also:
Tokenizer, AbstractTokenizer

Method Detail

isWhitespace

public boolean isWhitespace(char testChar)
Deprecated. 
This method checks if the character is a whitespace.

Parameters:
testChar - check this character
Returns:
true if the given character is a whitespace, false otherwise

readWhitespaces

public int readWhitespaces(int startingAtPos,
                           int maxChars)
                    throws TokenizerException
Deprecated. 
This method detects the number of whitespace characters starting at the given position. It should use Tokenizer.getChar(int) to retrieve a character to check.
The method should return the number of characters identified as whitespaces starting from and including the given start position.
Do not attempt to actually read more data or do anything that leads to the change of the data source or to tokenizer switching. This is done by the tokenizer framework.

Parameters:
startingAtPos - start checking for whitespace from this position
maxChars - if there is no non-whitespace character, read up to this number of characters
Returns:
number of whitespace characters starting from the given offset
Throws:
TokenizerException - failure while reading data from the input stream
